node.title: Effects of climate change taking root in the wine industry
node.description: Climate change is jolting the wine industry. Lesley Stahl reports on how the economics, practices and in some cases even the flavors of wine are being altered by our shifting climate.

node.title: Publicly listed companies expected to deliver mixed earnings results
node.description: Publicly listed companies are expected to deliver a mixed bag of earnings results depending on their exposure to Covid-related disruptions and cautious outlooks for the rest of the year.

node.title: Ocean carbon sinks could play critical role in stabilising planet
node.description: Comment - We think of trees and soil as carbon sinks, but the world's oceans hold far larger carbon stocks and are more effective at storing carbon permanently.

node.title: Dwayne Johnson gets the crowd energized.
node.description: The actor took to the field right before kickoff.

node.title: Covid-19: Many NZers likely to encounter virus in coming weeks - expert
node.description: Experts are urging those eligible for a Covid-19 booster vaccine to get their shot as soon as possible after a near-doubling of daily Covid-19 case numbers.

node.title: Communication with protesters difficult but negotiators making progress - Police boss
node.description: Police have crack negotiators on the job trying to end the occupation of Parliament's grounds, Wellington's police district commander says. Audio

node.title: New fund targets 20,000 nurses who have left profession
node.description: The Health Ministry has launched a $1 million fund to attract former nurses back to the profession in the pandemic.

node.title: Fleming grabs Black Caps for IPL
node.description: The Stephen Fleming coached Chennai Super Kings have grabbed three Black Caps on the second day of the Indian Premier League auction in Bangalore.

node.title: The Week in Politics: Protest overshadows Parliament's first week
node.description: Analysis - A "reset" National Party takes on the government during Parliament's first week, but protests outside on the grounds dominate the media; and another poll shows National gaining ground.

node.title: Covid-19: School mask mandate tricky for some
node.description: Principals say some schools and teachers are ignoring or misinterpreting the mask mandate for school children.

node.title: New Black Ferns contracts unveiled
node.description: After more than ten years juggling work and training commitment the country's top female rugby players will be able to behind their day jobs to focus on rugby.

node.title: Wild weather: Road damage, power cuts after gales, downpours in North Island
node.description: Slips and debris on North Island roads after a weekend of wild weather will take days to fully clean up, Waka Kotahi says. Audio

node.title: Bad then, worse now: How Covid-19 will hurt retired women
node.description: Women are worse off than men in retirement - and experts predict Covid-19 will make things worse, Naomi Arnold reports.

node.title: Cost of Super Bowl snacks hits watchers harder in 2022
node.description: Higher prices are hitting the foods Americans snack on during the big game.

node.title: FENZ identifies various faults in hospitals' fire safety design
node.description: Official reviews of fire safety designs in hospitals have found many faults.

node.title: Ukraine crisis: 'We are in step with international partners' - Mahuta
node.description: The Foreign Affairs minister says New Zealand joins its global partners in seeking a de-escalation of tension on Ukraine's border where it is feared Russia's military build-up may lead to conflict. Audio

node.title: Police appeal to protesters at Parliament to clear the streets
node.description: Police are appealing to protesters encamped at Parliament to work with them to try and clear the streets of Wellington.

node.title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation" on February 13, 2022

node.title: Covid-19: 810 new community cases in NZ today
node.description: The number of new community cases in New Zealand has almost doubled today, with a record 810 new cases reported.

node.title: Underdog Bengals take on Hollywood Rams in Super Bowl
node.description: Underdog takes on all-star cast in Super Bowl LVI

node.title: Business leaders pessimistic on inflation forecasts
node.description: A new survey has delivered some sour news to the Reserve Bank with inflation expectations rising to their highest level in more than 30 years.

node.description: Experts are urging those eligible for a Covid-19 booster vaccine to get their shot as soon as possible after a near-doubling of daily Covid-19 case numbers.

node.title: UFC: Adesanya retains middleweight championship
node.description: UFC star Israel Adesanya has beaten former champion Robert Whittaker via unanimous decision to retain the middleweight championship at UFC 271 in Houston, Texas.

node.title: Police launch bid to clear Canada trucker blockade
node.description: Police have started to clear a blockade of the main crossing between Canada and the United States.

node.title: Sir Mark Todd apologises after video emerges of him apparently hitting horse
node.description: Former Olympic champion Sir Mark Todd has apologised after a video on social media showed him appearing to hit a horse with a branch.

node.title: After a reply on Instagram, Eileen Gu faces criticism over ‘special treatment.’
node.description: Social media users criticized the Chinese American skier after she suggested they download tools to use the internet that are illegal for most Chinese citizens.

node.title: Trial of Ex-Goldman Banker Involved in 1MDB Scandal Set to Begin
node.description: Roger Ng was indicted in 2018 for his role in the looting of Malaysia’s government fund. His trial starts Monday.

node.title: Court expected to rule if Russian teen sensation can continue.

node.title: Kinzinger says January 6 committee "fully" expects Giuliani's cooperation
node.description: The committee asked Giuliani to turn over documents by February 1 and testify February 8.
